Array.name: clear
Array.description: Clears the array.

Array.name: clone
Array.description: Creates a deep copy of the array.

Array.name: concat
Array.description: Concatenates (joins) two or more arrays

Array.name: contains
Array.description: Searches for the element in the array.

Array.name: every
Array.description: Checks if all array elements pass a function test.

Array.name: filter
Array.description: Creates a new array filled with elements that pass the function test.

Array.name: find
Array.description: Returns the value of the first element that passes the function test.

Array.name: findIndex
Array.description: Returns the index of the first element that passes the function test.

Array.name: forEach
Array.description: Calls a function for each element.

Array.name: indexOf
Array.description: Searches the array and returns the first index.

Array.name: insert
Array.description: Inserts the given arguments at the firstIndex.

Array.name: isArray
Array.description: Checks if the given variable is an array.

Array.name: join
Array.description: Joins the array into a string with the given separator.
Array.example:
!!javascript
const var list = ["item1", "item2", "item3"];     // Creates a list of all available samplemaps
const var box = Content.addComboBox("box", 0, 0); // Creates a combobox
box.set("items", list.join("\n"));                // sets the list as items

Array.name: map
Array.description: Creates a new array from calling a function for every array element.

Array.name: pop
Array.description: Removes and returns the last element.

Array.name: push
Array.description: Adds the given element at the end and returns the size.

Array.name: pushIfNotAlreadyThere
Array.description: Adds the given element at the end and returns the size.

Array.name: remove
Array.description: Removes all instances of the given element.

Array.name: removeElement
Array.description: Removes the element at the given position.

Array.name: reserve
Array.description: Reserves the space needed for the given amount of elements.
Array.example:
const var array = [];       // create a new array
array.reserve(128);         // allocate 128 items
Console.print(array.length) // will output 0;
array[64] = 190;            // this will not allocate
Console.print(array.length) // will print 65

Array.name: reverse
Array.description: Reverses the order of the elements in the array.

Array.name: shift
Array.description: Removes and returns the first element.

Array.name: some
Array.description: Checks if any array elements pass a function test.

Array.name: sort
Array.description: Sorts the array.

Array.name: sortNatural
Array.description: Sorts array of numbers, objects, or strings with "number in string" priority. Can also sort a combination of all types

AudioFile.name: getNumSamples
getRange

AudioFile.description: Returns the samplerate of the audio file.

AudioFile.name: getTotalLengthInSamples

AudioFile.name: linkTo
AudioFile.description: Links this audio file to the other

AudioFile.name: loadBuffer

AudioFile.name: loadFile

AudioFile.name: setContentCallback

AudioFile.name: setDisplayCallback

AudioFile.name: setRange
update

BackgroundTask.name: callOnBackgroundThread
BackgroundTask.description: Call a function on the background thread.

BackgroundTask.name: getProgress
BackgroundTask.description: Get the progress for this task.

BackgroundTask.name: getProperty
BackgroundTask.description: Retrieve a property through a thread safe container.

BackgroundTask.name: killVoicesAndCall
BackgroundTask.description: Kills all voices and calls the given function on the sample loading thread.

BackgroundTask.name: runProcess
BackgroundTask.description: Spawns a OS process and executes it with the given command line arguments.

BackgroundTask.name: sendAbortSignal
BackgroundTask.description: Signal that this thread should exit.

BackgroundTask.name: setFinishCallback
BackgroundTask.description: Set a function that will be called when the task has started / stopped.

BackgroundTask.name: setForwardStatusToLoadingThread
BackgroundTask.description: Forward the state of this thread to the sample loading thread notification system.

BackgroundTask.name: setProgress
BackgroundTask.description: Set a progress for this task.

BackgroundTask.name: setProperty
BackgroundTask.description: Set a property to a thread safe container.

BackgroundTask.name: setTimeOut
shouldAbort
BackgroundTask.description: Checks whether the task should be aborted (either because of recompilation or when you called abort().

BeatportManager.name: isBeatportAccess
BeatportManager.description: Checks if the beatport access is valid.

BeatportManager.name: validate
BeatportManager.description: Requests DRM validation and returns a JSON object with the validation result.

Broadcaster.name: addComponentPropertyListener
Broadcaster.arguments: (var object, var propertyList, var metadata, var optionalFunction)
Broadcaster.description: Adds a listener that sets the properties of the given components when the broadcaster receives a message.

Broadcaster.name: addComponentRefreshListener
Broadcaster.description: Adds a listener that will cause a refresh message (eg. repaint(), changed()) to be send out to the given components.

Broadcaster.name: addComponentValueListener
Broadcaster.description: Adds a listener that sets the value of the given components when the broadcaster receives a message.

Broadcaster.name: addDelayedListener
Broadcaster.arguments: (int delayInMilliSeconds, var obj, var metadata, var function)
Broadcaster.description: Adds a listener that will be executed with a delay.

Broadcaster.name: addListener
Broadcaster.description: Adds a listener that is notified when a message is send. The object can be either a JSON object, a script object or a simple string.

Broadcaster.name: addModuleParameterSyncer
Broadcaster.description: Adds a listener that will sync module parameters from the attached module parameter source.

Broadcaster.name: attachToComplexData
Broadcaster.arguments: (String dataTypeAndEvent, var moduleIds, var dataIndexes, var optionalMetadata)
Broadcaster.description: Registers this broadcaster to be notified when a complex data object changes.

Broadcaster.name: attachToComponentMouseEvents
Broadcaster.description: Registers this broadcaster to be notified for mouse events for the given components.

Broadcaster.name: attachToComponentProperties
Broadcaster.description: Registers this broadcaster to be called when one of the properties of the given components change.

Broadcaster.name: attachToComponentValue
Broadcaster.description: Registers this broadcaster to be called when the value of the given components change.

Broadcaster.name: attachToComponentVisibility
Broadcaster.description: Registers this broadcaster to be called when the visibility of one of the components (or one of its parent component) changes.

Broadcaster.name: attachToContextMenu
Broadcaster.arguments: (var componentIds, var stateFunction, var itemList, var optionalMetadata, var useLeftClick)
Broadcaster.description: Registers this broadcaster to be notified when a context menu item from the given components was selected.

Broadcaster.name: attachToEqEvents
Broadcaster.description: Registers this broadcaster to be notified about changes to the EQ (adding / removing / selecting filter bands).

Broadcaster.name: attachToInterfaceSize
Broadcaster.description: Registers the broadcaster to be notified when the interface size changes.

Broadcaster.name: attachToModuleParameter
Broadcaster.description: Registers this broadcaster to be notified when a module parameter changes.

Broadcaster.name: attachToNonRealtimeChange
Broadcaster.description: Attaches this broadcaster to receive realtime / nonrealtime render change events.

Broadcaster.name: attachToOtherBroadcaster
Broadcaster.arguments: (var otherBroadcaster, var argTransformFunction, bool async, var optionalMetadata)
Broadcaster.description: Attaches this broadcaster to another broadcaster(s) to forward the messages.

Broadcaster.name: attachToProcessingSpecs
Broadcaster.description: Attaches this broadcaster to changes of the audio processing specs (samplerate / buffer size).

Broadcaster.name: attachToRadioGroup
Broadcaster.description: Registers this broadcaster to be notified when a button of a radio group is clicked.

Broadcaster.name: attachToRoutingMatrix
Broadcaster.description: Attaches this broadcaster to a routing matrix and listens for changes.

Broadcaster.name: attachToSampleMap
Broadcaster.description: Attaches the broadcaster to events of a samplemap (loading, changing, adding samples).

Broadcaster.name: callWithDelay
Broadcaster.description: Calls a function after a short period of time. This is exclusive, so if you pass in a new function while another is pending, the first will be replaced.

Broadcaster.name: isBypassed
Broadcaster.description: Checks if the broadcaster is bypassed.

Broadcaster.name: refreshContextMenuState
Broadcaster.description: If this broadcaster is attached to a context menu, calling this method will update the states for the menu items.

Broadcaster.name: removeAllListeners
Broadcaster.description: Removes all listeners.

Broadcaster.name: removeAllSources
Broadcaster.description: Removes all sources.

Broadcaster.name: removeListener
Broadcaster.description: Removes the listener that was assigned with the given object.

Broadcaster.name: removeSource
Broadcaster.description: Removes the source with the given metadata.

Broadcaster.name: resendLastMessage
Broadcaster.description: Resends the current state.

Broadcaster.name: reset
Broadcaster.description: Resets the state.

Broadcaster.name: sendAsyncMessage
Broadcaster.description: Sends an asynchronous message to all listeners. the length of args must match the default value list.

Broadcaster.name: sendMessage
Broadcaster.description: deprecated function (use sendSyncMessage / sendAsyncMessage instead).

Broadcaster.name: sendMessageWithDelay
Broadcaster.description: Sends a message to all listeners with a delay.

Broadcaster.name: sendSyncMessage
Broadcaster.description: Sends a synchronous message to all listeners (same as the dot assignment operator). the length of args must match the default value list.

Broadcaster.name: setBypassed
Broadcaster.description: Deactivates the broadcaster so that it will not send messages. If sendMessageIfEnabled is true, it will send the last value when unbypassed.

Broadcaster.name: setEnableQueue
Broadcaster.description: If this is enabled, the broadcaster will keep an internal queue of all messages and will guarantee to send them all.

Broadcaster.name: setForceSynchronousExecution
Broadcaster.description: Forces every message to be sent synchronously.

Broadcaster.name: setRealtimeMode
Broadcaster.description: Guarantees that the synchronous execution of the listener callbacks can be called from the audio thread.

Broadcaster.name: setReplaceThisReference
Broadcaster.description: This will control whether the `this` reference for the listener function will be replaced with the object passed into `addListener`.

Broadcaster.name: setSendMessageForUndefinedArgs
Broadcaster.description: Forces the broadcaster to also send a message when a parameter is undefined.

Buffer.name: applyMedianFilter
Buffer.description: Applies a median filter with zero padding to the buffer and returns the filtered median values.

Buffer.name: decompose
Buffer.description: Analyses the sample and splits it into sinusoidal, transient & residual noise components.

Buffer.name: detectPitch
Buffer.description: Detects the pitch of the given buffer.

Buffer.name: fromBase64
Buffer.description: Loads the content from the Base64 string (and resizes the buffer if necessary).

Buffer.name: getMagnitude
Buffer.description: Returns the magnitude in the given range.

Buffer.name: getNextZeroCrossing
Buffer.description: Returns the next zero crossing at the position.

Buffer.name: getPeakRange
Buffer.description: Returns an array with the min and max value in the given range.

Buffer.name: getRMSLevel
Buffer.description: Returns the RMS value in the given range.

Buffer.name: getSlice
Buffer.description: Returns a new buffer that contains a reference to a slice of this buffer.

Buffer.name: indexOfPeak
Buffer.description: Returns the sample index with the highest peak.

Buffer.name: normalise
Buffer.description: Normalises the buffer to the given decibel value.

Buffer.name: resample
Buffer.description: Returns a resampled buffer using the given resample ratio and interpolation type.

Buffer.name: toBase64
Buffer.description: Converts a buffer with up to 44100 samples to a Base64 string.

Buffer.name: toCharString
Buffer.description: Returns a char from 0 to 255 with the given length and input range.

Buffer.name: trim
Buffer.description: Trims a buffer at the start and end and returns a copy of it.

Builder.name: clear
Builder.description: WARNING: Clears all child sound generators, effects and MIDI processor (except for this one obviously).

Builder.description: Clears all child processors of the chain in the module with the given build index

Builder.name: connectToScript
Builder.description: Connects the script processor to an external script.

Builder.name: create
Builder.arguments: (var type, var id, int rootBuildIndex, int chainIndex)
Builder.description: Creates a module and returns the build index (0=master container).

Builder.name: flush
Builder.description: Sends a rebuild message. Call this after you've created all the processors to make sure that the patch browser is updated accordingly.

Builder.name: get
Builder.description: Returns a typed reference for the module with the given build index.

Builder.name: getExisting
Builder.description: Adds the existing module to the internal list and returns the index for refering to it.

Builder.name: setAttributes
Builder.description: Set multiple attributes for the given module at once using a JSON object.

ChildSynth.name: exportState

ChildSynth.name: getAttribute

ChildSynth.name: getAttributeId

ChildSynth.name: getAttributeIndex

ChildSynth.name: getChildSynthByIndex
ChildSynth.description: Returns the child synth with the given index.

ChildSynth.name: getCurrentLevel

ChildSynth.name: getId

ChildSynth.name: getModulatorChain

ChildSynth.name: getNumAttributes

ChildSynth.name: getRoutingMatrix

ChildSynth.name: isBypassed
ChildSynth.description: Checks if the synth is bypassed.

ChildSynth.name: restoreState

ChildSynth.name: setAttribute
ChildSynth.description: Changes one of the Parameter. Look in the manual for the index numbers of each effect.

ChildSynth.name: setBypassed
ChildSynth.description: Bypasses the synth.

ChildSynth.name: setEffectChainOrder

ChildSynth.name: setModulationInitialValue

Colours.name: fromHsl
Colours.description: Converts a colour from a [h, s, l, a] float array to a uint32 value.

Colours.name: fromVec4
Colours.description: Converts a colour from a [r, g, b, a] float array to a uint32 value.

Colours.name: toHsl
Colours.description: Converts a colour to a [h, s, l, a] array.

Colours.name: toVec4
Colours.description: Converts a colour to a [r, g, b, a] array that can be passed to GLSL as vec4.

Colours.name: withAlpha

Colours.name: withBrightness

Colours.name: withMultipliedAlpha

Colours.name: withMultipliedBrightness
Colours.description: Returns a colour with a multiplied brightness value.

ComplexGroupManager.name: addGroupEventStartOffset

Content.name: addVisualGuide
Content.description: Creates either a line or rectangle with the given colour.
Content.example:
Content.addVisualGuide([0, 200], Colours.white);       // adds a horizontal line at 200px
Content.addVisualGuide([100, 0], Colours.red);         // adds a vertical line at 100px

Content.addVisualGuide(0, 0);                          // clears all visual guides

```javascript
Effect.name: setDraggableFilterData
Effect.description: Sets the draggable filter data object (if applicable).
Effect.example:
parameterIndex = 0 + bandIndex * BandOffset + bandParameterIndex
P			   = O + I         * N          + B
```

(we'll refer to the variable names `P, O, I, N and B` down below). So for all the other module types, you will need to provide additional information about the properties of the filter module that will be picked up by the draggable filter panel to adjust it's behaviour.

> Note that these properties are not persistently stored in the module tree, so you have to call this function in the onInit callback for each module.

These properties are available:

| Property | Type | Default | Description |
| == | = | = | ===== |
| NumFilterBands | int | 1 | The fixed amount of filter bands of this module. Note that this is a hard limitation and the only module that allows a dynamic amount of filter bands remains the Parametric EQ. |
| FilterDataSlot | int | 0 | the slot of the filter coefficients. This defaults to zero and you can assign all your filter nodes to the same coefficient object, but if you have a more complex node where the filter is only a part of the signal chain, you can define which filter coefficient slot it should use for the draggable display. |
| FirstBandOffset | int | 0 | the parameterOffset for the first band (`O` in the formula above). This can be used if your filter module has parameters that come before the range of filter parameters and will be used as constant offset in the formula that calculates the filter band parameter (see below). |
| TypeList | Array | see below | This is a list of strings that define the type names as they will show up in the context menu when you right click on a filter drag handle. |
| ParameterOrder | Array | see below | This is a list of (predefined) string that will define in what order the filter parameters are defined. The length of this list will be `N` in the formula above and it will calculate the bandParameterIndex `B` from the index of the parameter name within that list. |
| FFTDisplayBufferIndex | int | -1 | This is the index of the display buffer that will be used to show the spectrum analyser. If you set this to anything other than -1, it must point to a external display buffer that is connected to a [analyse.fft](/scriptnode/list/analyse/fft) node. |
| DragActions | Array | see below | This is a list of predefined strings that define the mouse behaviour and what parameter you want to control. Eg, by default the y-axis is assigned to the gain parameter, but in a synth filter context you might want to reroute this to the resonance of the filter and this is the place to do so. |

If you define this JSON object and pass it to this method, HISE has all information it needs to calculate the band parameter index from the attribute index of the module parameter:

```javascript
O = FirstBandOffset
N = TypeList.length
B = TypeList.indexOf(BAND_PARAMETER)

parameterIndex = FirstBandOffset + bandIndex * TypeList.length + TypeList.indexOf(BAND_PARAMETER)
```

Here is a list of all default values as JSON (that is also returned by [Effect.getDraggableFilterData()](/scripting/scripting-api/effect#getdraggablefilterdata))

```javascript
{
  NumFilterBands: 1, 
  FilterDataSlot: 0, 
  FirstBandOffset: 0, 
  TypeList: [
    "Low Pass", 
    "High Pass",
    "Low Shelf",
    "High Shelf",
    "Peak"
  ],
  ParameterOrder: [
    "Gain",
    "Freq",
    "Q",
    "Enabled",
    "Type"
  ],
  FFTDisplayBufferIndex: -1, 
  DragActions: {
    DragX: "Freq",
    DragY: "Gain", 
    ShiftDrag: "Q", 
    DoubleClick: "Enabled",
    RightClick: ""
  }
};
```
