Synth.name: getSlotFX
Synth.description: Returns the first slot with the given name.

Synth.name: getTableProcessor
Synth.description: Returns the table processor with the given name.

Synth.name: getTimerInterval
Synth.description: Returns the current timer interval in seconds.

Synth.name: getWavetableController
Synth.description: Creates a object to control the wavetable synthesiser features.

Synth.name: isArtificialEventActive
Synth.description: Checks if the artificial event is active

Synth.name: isKeyDown
Synth.description: Checks if the given key is pressed.

Synth.name: isLegatoInterval
Synth.description: Checks if any key is pressed.

Synth.name: isSustainPedalDown
Synth.description: Returns true if the sustain pedal is pressed.

Synth.name: isTimerRunning
Synth.description: Checks if the timer for this script is running.

Synth.name: noteOff
Synth.description: Sends a note off message. The envelopes will tail off.

Synth.name: noteOffByEventId
Synth.description: Sends a note off message for the supplied event ID. This is more stable than the deprecated noteOff() method.

Synth.name: noteOffDelayedByEventId
Synth.description: Sends a note off message for the supplied event ID with the given delay in samples.

Synth.name: noteOffFromUI
Synth.description: Injects a note off to the incoming MIDI buffer (similar to playNoteFromUI).

Synth.name: playNote
Synth.description: Plays a note and returns the event id. Be careful or you get stuck notes!

Synth.name: playNoteFromUI
Synth.description: Injects a note on to the incoming MIDI buffer (just as if the virtual keyboard was pressed.

Synth.name: playNoteWithStartOffset
Synth.arguments: (int channel, int number, int velocity, int offset)
Synth.description: Plays a note and returns the event id with the given channel and start offset.

Synth.name: removeEffect
Synth.description: Removes the given effect.

Synth.name: removeModulator
Synth.description: Removes the modulator.

Synth.name: sendController
Synth.description: Sends a controller event to the synth.

Synth.name: sendControllerToChildSynths
Synth.description: The same as sendController (for backwards compatibility)

Synth.name: setAttribute
Synth.description: Sets an attribute of the parent synth.

Synth.name: setClockSpeed
Synth.description: Sets the internal clock speed.

Synth.name: setFixNoteOnAfterNoteOff
Synth.description: Adds a few additional safe checks to prevent stuck notes from note offs being processed before their note-on message.

Synth.name: setMacroControl
Synth.description: Sets one of the eight macro controllers to the newValue.

Synth.name: setModulatorAttribute
Synth.arguments: (int chainId, int modulatorIndex, int attributeIndex, float newValue)
Synth.description: Sets a ModulatorAttribute.

Synth.name: setShouldKillRetriggeredNote
Synth.description: If set to true, this will kill retriggered notes (default).

Synth.name: setUseUniformVoiceHandler
Synth.description: Use a uniform voice index for the given container.

Synth.name: setVoiceGainValue
Synth.description: Applies a gain factor to a specified voice.

Synth.name: setVoicePitchValue
Synth.description: Applies a pitch factor (0.5 ... 2.0) to a specified voice.

Synth.name: startTimer
Synth.description: Starts the timer of the synth.

Synth.name: stopTimer
Synth.description: Stops the timer of the synth. You can call this also in the timer callback.

Threads.name: getCurrentThread
Threads.description: Returns the thread ID of the thread that is calling this method.

Threads.name: getCurrentThreadName
Threads.description: Returns the name of the current thread (for debugging purposes only!).

Threads.name: getLockerThread
Threads.description: Returns the thread ID of the thread the locks the given thread ID.

Threads.name: isAudioRunning
Threads.description: Returns true if the audio callback is running or false if it's suspended during a load operation.

Threads.name: isCurrentlyExporting
Threads.description: Returns true if the audio exporter is currently rendering the audio on a background thread.

Threads.name: isLocked
Threads.description: Returns true if the given thread is currently locked.

Threads.name: isLockedByCurrentThread
Threads.description: Returns true if the given thread is currently locked by the current thread.

Threads.name: killVoicesAndCall
Threads.description: Kills all voices, suspends the audio processing and calls the given function on the loading thread. Returns true if the function was executed synchronously.

Threads.name: startProfiling
Threads.description: Starts a profiling session and calls the finishCallback when ready.

Threads.name: toString
Threads.description: Returns the name of the given string (for debugging purposes only!).

ThreadSafeStorage.name: clear
ThreadSafeStorage.description: Clears the data. If another thread tries to read the value, it will block until that operation is done.

ThreadSafeStorage.name: load
ThreadSafeStorage.description: Loads the data. If the data is currently being written, this will lock and wait until the write operation is completed.

ThreadSafeStorage.name: store
ThreadSafeStorage.description: Writes the given data to the internal storage. If another thread tries to read the value, it will block until that operation is done.

ThreadSafeStorage.name: storeWithCopy
ThreadSafeStorage.description: Creates a copy of the data and writes the copy to the data storage. If another thread tries to read the value, it will block until that operation is done.

ThreadSafeStorage.name: tryLoad
ThreadSafeStorage.description: Loads the data if the lock can be gained or returns a given default value if the data is currently being written.

Timer.name: getMilliSecondsSinceCounterReset
Timer.description: Returns the duration from the last counter reset.

Timer.name: isTimerRunning
Timer.description: Checks if the timer is active.

Timer.name: setTimerCallback
Timer.description: Sets the function that will be called periodically.

TransportHandler.name: getGridLengthInSamples
TransportHandler.description: Returns the number of samples for the current grid duration.

TransportHandler.name: setLinkBpmToSyncMode

TransportHandler.name: setLocalGridBypassed

TransportHandler.name: setLocalGridMultiplier

TransportHandler.name: setOnBeatChange

TransportHandler.name: setOnBypass

TransportHandler.name: setOnGridChange
TransportHandler.description: Registers a callback to changes in the grid.

TransportHandler.name: setOnSignatureChange
TransportHandler.description: Registers a callback to time signature changes.

TransportHandler.name: setOnTempoChange
TransportHandler.description: Registers a callback to tempo changes.

TransportHandler.name: setOnTransportChange
TransportHandler.description: Registers a callback to transport state changes (playing / stopping).

TransportHandler.name: setSyncMode

TransportHandler.name: stopInternalClockOnExternalStop

Unlocker.name: canExpire

Unlocker.name: contains

Unlocker.name: getLicenseKeyFile

Unlocker.name: getRegisteredMachineId

Unlocker.name: getUserEmail

Unlocker.name: isUnlocked
Unlocker.description: Checks if the registration went OK.

Unlocker.name: isValidKeyFile

Unlocker.name: loadExpansionList

Unlocker.name: loadKeyFile

Unlocker.name: unlockExpansionList

UnorderedStack.name: asBuffer
UnorderedStack.description: Returns a buffer that refers the data.

UnorderedStack.name: contains
UnorderedStack.description: checks if the number is in the stack.

UnorderedStack.name: copyTo
UnorderedStack.description: Copies the stack into the given container.

UnorderedStack.name: insert
UnorderedStack.description: Inserts a number at the end of the stack.

UnorderedStack.name: isEmpty
UnorderedStack.description: Checks if any number is present in the stack.

UnorderedStack.name: remove
UnorderedStack.description: removes the given number and fills the gap.

UnorderedStack.name: removeElement
UnorderedStack.description: Removes the element at the given number and fills the gap.

UnorderedStack.name: removeIfEqual
UnorderedStack.description: Removes the matching event from the stack and puts it in the holder.

UnorderedStack.name: setIsEventStack
UnorderedStack.description: Sets this stack to hold HISE events rather than floating point numbers.

UnorderedStack.name: size
UnorderedStack.description: Returns the number of values in the stack.

UnorderedStack.name: storeEvent
UnorderedStack.description: Stores the event into the message holder.

UserPresetHandler.name: attachAutomationCallback
UserPresetHandler.description: Attaches a callback to automation changes. Pass a non-function as updateCallback to remove the callback for the given automation ID.

UserPresetHandler.name: clearAttachedCallbacks
UserPresetHandler.description: Clears all attached callbacks.

UserPresetHandler.name: createObjectForAutomationValues
UserPresetHandler.description: Creates an object containing the values for every automation ID.

UserPresetHandler.name: createObjectForSaveInPresetComponents
UserPresetHandler.description: Creates an object containing all values of components with the `saveInPreset` flag.

UserPresetHandler.name: getAutomationIndex
UserPresetHandler.description: Returns the automation index.

UserPresetHandler.name: getSecondsSinceLastPresetLoad
UserPresetHandler.description: Returns the amount of seconds since the last preset has been loaded.

UserPresetHandler.name: isCurrentlyLoadingPreset
UserPresetHandler.description: Returns true if this is called somewhere inside a preset load. This takes the thread ID into account to avoid false positives when calling this on another thread.

UserPresetHandler.name: isInternalPresetLoad
UserPresetHandler.description: Returns true if the user preset that is about to be loaded is a DAW state (or initial state). This function is only useful during the pre / post load callbacks.

UserPresetHandler.name: isOldVersion
UserPresetHandler.description: Checks if the given version string is a older version than the current project version number.

UserPresetHandler.name: resetToDefaultUserPreset
UserPresetHandler.description: Loads the default user preset (if it's defined in the project).

UserPresetHandler.name: runTest
UserPresetHandler.description: Runs a few tests that catches data persistency issues.

UserPresetHandler.name: sendParameterGesture
UserPresetHandler.description: Sends a parameter gesture change message to the host. Returns true if the parameter exists.

UserPresetHandler.name: setAutomationValue
UserPresetHandler.description: Sends an automation value change for the given index.

UserPresetHandler.name: setCustomAutomation
UserPresetHandler.description: Enables host / MIDI automation with the custom user preset model.

UserPresetHandler.name: setEnableUserPresetPreprocessing
UserPresetHandler.description: Enables a preprocessing of every user preset that is being loaded.

UserPresetHandler.name: setParameterGestureCallback
UserPresetHandler.description: Attaches a callback to the begin and end of parameter gestures.

UserPresetHandler.name: setPluginParameterGroupNames
UserPresetHandler.description: Sets the available group names for plugin parameter groups.

UserPresetHandler.name: setPluginParameterSortFunction
UserPresetHandler.description: Sets a custom sort function for the plugin parameter order.

UserPresetHandler.name: setPostCallback
UserPresetHandler.description: Sets a callback that will be executed after the preset has been loaded.

UserPresetHandler.name: setPostSaveCallback
UserPresetHandler.description: Sets a callback that will be executed after a preset has been saved.

UserPresetHandler.name: setPreCallback
UserPresetHandler.description: Sets a callback that will be executed synchronously before the preset was loaded

UserPresetHandler.name: setUseCustomUserPresetModel
UserPresetHandler.description: Disables the default user preset data model and allows a manual data handling.

UserPresetHandler.name: setUseUndoForPresetLoading
UserPresetHandler.description: Enables Engine.undo() to restore the previous user preset (default is disabled).

UserPresetHandler.name: updateAutomationValues
UserPresetHandler.description: Updates the given automation values and optionally sends out a message.

UserPresetHandler.name: updateConnectedComponentsFromModuleState
UserPresetHandler.description: Restores the values for all UI elements that are connected to a processor with the `processorID` / `parameterId` properties.

UserPresetHandler.name: updateSaveInPresetComponents
UserPresetHandler.description: Restores all values of components with the `saveInPreset` flag.

WavetableController.name: getResynthesisOptions
WavetableController.description: Returns a JSON object with the current resynthesis options.

WavetableController.name: loadData
WavetableController.description: Loads a file (or buffer) into the wavetable synth.

WavetableController.name: resynthesise
WavetableController.description: Resynthesises the wavetables from the currently loaded audio file.

WavetableController.name: saveAsAudioFile
WavetableController.description: Saves the currently loaded wavetable as audio file.

WavetableController.name: saveAsHwt
WavetableController.description: Saves the currently loaded wavetable as HWT file somewhere.

WavetableController.name: setEnableResynthesisCache
WavetableController.description: This will store all resynthesised wavetables to the given directory and reused if the same file is loaded again.

WavetableController.name: setErrorHandler
WavetableController.description: Sets up a function that will be executed when a error occurs during resynthesis.

WavetableController.name: setPostFXProcessors
WavetableController.description: Sets up a chain of post FX processors that will be applied to the loaded wavetable.
WavetableController.example:
wavetable_out = f(wavetable_in, parameter)
```

> The functions are baked into the wavetables and are properly band limited using the same mip-map technique as when loading a normal wavetable, so these functions are not subject to realtime-manipulation, but will yield a alias-free sound.

### Post processing function definition

You can use multiple post processing steps at once and they will be serially processed in order of definition. This function expects an array of JSON objects that describe every function. These are the supported properties:

| Property | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | -------- |
| `Type` | String | The type of FX from a predefined list (see below). |
| `min` | double | the parameter value for the lowest table index. |
| `max` | double | the parameter value for the highest table index. |
| `middlePosition` | double | the parameter value for the middle table index. |
| `TableProcessor` | String | The name of the HISE module that provides the Table (see below) |
| `TableIndex` | int | the index of the table that should be used for the parameter lookup table. |

As you can see, with the exception of the `Type` parameter that defines the function, all other properties are related to how the single `parameter` will change for different table indexes, which allows you to create a dynamic function curve that you then can modulate through the `TableIndex` parameter of the wavetable synth: for each cycle in the wavetable it will:

1. normalize the cycle position (so that if the wavetable has 100 cycles, the 50th cycle will have the position `0.5`)
2. Apply the [Table](/ui-components/plugin-components/table) (if defined) so that you can fully customize the curve if desired.
3. Scale it to the range provided by the `min`, `max` and `middlePosition` attributes
4. Apply the function to the entire cycle of the wavetable with the calculated `parameter` value

Here are a few examples that demonstrate the different use cases:

```javascript
// A wavefold FX with a constant parameter of 0.8
{
	Type: "Fold",
	min: 0.8,
	max: 0.8
}

// A hard sync effect with a parameter of 0 at the first table 
// and a parameter value of 0.5 at the last table
{
	Type: "Sync",
	min: 0.0,
	max: 0.5
}

// A FM effect using a sine wave with the same frequency as carrier
// and the first table of the main UI defining the curve from 0.0 to 16.0
{
	Type: "FM1",
	min: 0.0,
	max: 16.0,
	TableProcessor: "Interface",
	TableIndex: 0
}
